title: An Introduction to Statistical learning
text:
Lecture slides, class notes, and problem sets are linked below. New material is added approximately on a weekly basis.









#
Module
Detailed Topics
#M




1
Foundations
Python; variables & data types; arrays & DataFrames; file I/O; NumPy; Pandas
1


2
Machine Learning
Optimization; definition and scope
1


3
Linear Regression
OLS; interpretation; residual analysis; collinearity; diagnostics; training vs testing
2


4
Logistic Regression
Odds & log-odds; diagnostics; ROC; model comparison
2


5
Feature Engineering
Scaling; centering; transformations; interaction; encoding; preprocessing pipelines
2


6
Lasso Regression
Regularization; penalty; cross-validation; sparse solutions; stability of selected features
2


7
K-Nearest Neighbors
Distance; normalization; tuning K; visualization of decision regions; bias/variance
1


8
Support Vector Machines
Maximum margin classifier; loss; kernel; comparison to KNN and logistic
1


9
Decision Trees
Recursive partitioning; entropy and Gini; overfitting; pruning
1


10
CART
Classification and regression trees; applications and technical aspects
2


11
Ensemble Methods
Boosting; bagging; bias–variance trade-off; AdaBoost; random forest
1


12
Model Selection
Overfitting vs generalization; LOOCV; k-fold CV; best subset; stepwise; shrinkage
1


13
Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
Eigenvectors; projections; loading interpretation; projection geometry
2


14
K-Means Clustering
Distance; within-cluster variance; scaling; elbow method; silhouette
1


15
Image Classification
Image normalization; flattening; PCA compression; nearest-neighbor classification; visualization
1


16
Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Bag-of-words; TF–IDF; sentiment scoring; logistic classifier; feature sparsity; interpretability
1

title: Introduction
text:
This is the AUM Data Science website.



 Back to top

title: Introduction to Data Science
text:
Lecture slides, class notes, and problem sets are linked below. New material is added approximately on a weekly basis.








Topic
Detailed Topics
#M




Intro to Python
Python basics; built-in data structures (lists, dicts, tuples, sets); data types; basic file I/O; use of interactive shell / Jupyter / IPython
2


Intermediate Python
NumPy; Matplotlib; Pandas; logic; control flow; loops; filtering
2


Python Tool Box
User-defined functions; lambda functions; iterators; comprehensions; generators; zip; streaming
2


Importing Data
Flat files; with; print; NumPy; DataFrames
1


Data Manipulation
Cleaning data; handling missing values; merging/joining tables; concatenation; reshaping (wide ↔︎ long); data transformation; groupby; split-apply-combine; aggregation; summarization
2


Data Visualization
Tools; simple line/scatter/density/histograms; Matplotlib; Seaborn
2

title: Statistics with R Programming
text:
Lecture slides, class notes, and problem sets are linked below. New material is added approximately on a weekly basis.










wk
Topic
Packages
Detailed Topics
#M




1
Introduction
base R
R; IDE; console vs script; working directory; packages; help system
1


2
R Basics I
base R
Objects; atomic vectors; matrices; lists; data frames; naming; inspection
1


3
R Basics II
base R
Subsetting; indexing; type coercion; NA handling; sorting; vector arithmetic; basic plotting
1


4
Programming
base R
Conditionals; loops; functions; scoping; vectorization; apply family
2


5
Data Wrangling
dplyr; magrittr
filter; select; mutate; summaries; pipe operator; tidy data; grouped operations
2


6
Importing Data
readr
CSV files; paths; data importing; fread; aggregation; sorting
2


7
Exploratory Data Analysis
base R; ggplot2
Summaries; distributions; groupwise comparisons; plots; exploratory analysis
3


8
Probability
base R
Probability rules; discrete & continuous models; random variables; expectation; variance; sampling; CLT; simulation
2


9
Statistical Inference
base R
Point estimation; standard error; confidence intervals; Monte Carlo inference; bootstrap; resampling logic
4


10
Hypothesis Testing
base R; stats
Null and alternative hypotheses; test statistics; p-values; significance level; power; bootstrap tests; interpretation
1


11
Linear Regression
stats
OLS derivation; assumptions; diagnostics; confidence intervals for coefficients; model selection; multicollinearity
3


12
Logistic Regression
stats
Odds; log-odds; likelihood; MLE; classification vs regression; diagnostics; interpretation
2


13
Treatment Effects & ANOVA
stats
One-way ANOVA; two-factor models; interactions; contrasts; interpretation
1


14
High-Dimensional Data
base R
Linear algebra; dimensional reduction; regularization; latent factors
3
